TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: ka sitsuayan ka mangtjengtjez qemiladj i Siniłizaw a salasaladj ni Salakats: ti Qaquangan ti Pałaiłai ti Tequng ti Qavulung ti Vałuan ti Taupili.
ka sicoayan ka mangtjengtjez qemiladj i Siniljizaw a salasaladj ni Salakac: ti Qaqoangan ti Paljailjai ti Teqong ti Qavolong ti Valjoan ti Taopili.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time the companions of Salakats came together and sat down at Siniłizaw: (the family heads of) Qaquangan, Pałaiłai, Tequng, Qavulung, Vałuan and Taupili.

S.FORM: "kitjen a imazanga i Siniłizaw," aya a varung niamadju.
"kitjen a imazanga i Siniljizaw," aya a varong niamadjo.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll stay here at Siniłizaw,” they thought.

S.FORM: manu izua vatu vuqavuqał.
mano izoa vato voqavoqalj.
S.TRANSL: But there was a white dog.

S.FORM: qau qemengal azua vatu; inika djułe i Siniłizaw.
qao qemengal azoa vato; inika djolje i Siniljizaw.
S.TRANSL: This dog howled and wouldn’t settle down at Siniłizaw.

S.FORM: "tjamanguaq a tji navaik, aya a varung nua vatu.
"tjamangoaq a tji navaik, aya a varong noa vato.
S.TRANSL: “The dog thinks we would do better to leave here.

S.FORM: masa inika djułe a vatu," aya.
masa inika djolje a vato," aya.
S.TRANSL: It seems the dog won’t settle down,” they said.

S.FORM: qau mirava tua nanemanemanga mapułat; sa vaik.
qao mirava toa nanemanemanga mapoljat; sa vaik.
S.TRANSL: So they all got everything ready, and left.

S.FORM: semekez i Tjanumaq a vatu.
semekez i Tjanomaq a vato.
S.TRANSL: The dog rested at Tjanumaq.

S.FORM: "masa uri a imaza itjen, a semekez a vatu," aya.
"masa ori a imaza itjen, a semekez a vato," aya.
S.TRANSL: “It seems we’ll stay here; the dog is resting,” they said.

S.FORM: qau vaik a uta a vatu.
qao vaik a ota a vato.
S.TRANSL: But the dog went on again,

S.FORM: qau semekez itjua Ḍaqaḍaqa.
qao semekez itjoa Draqadraqa.
S.TRANSL: and then rested at Ḍaqaḍaqa.

S.FORM: qau semekez a tsautsau.
qao semekez a caocao.
S.TRANSL: The people rested too.

S.FORM: "masa uri a imaza itjen," aya.
"masa ori a imaza itjen," aya.
S.TRANSL: “It seems we’ll stay here,” they said.

S.FORM: qau vaik a uta a vatu, tjału zua i tja tapaw tutsu.
qao vaik a ota a vato, tjaljo zoa i tja tapaw toco.
S.TRANSL: But the dog went on again, and reached where our houses are now.

S.FORM: kemali tua qipu a vatu sa qazaw.
kemali toa qipo a vato sa qazaw.
S.TRANSL: The dog dug in the ground and lay down.

S.FORM: "masa uri a imazanga a kadjułean nua vatu, a qemazaw imaza.
"masa ori a imazanga a kadjoljean noa vato, a qemazaw imaza.
S.TRANSL: “It seems that this will be where the dog will settle down at last, as it’s lying down here.

S.FORM: tja manguaq a tji naseman tapaw," aya małavar.
tja mangoaq a tji naseman tapaw," aya maljavar.
S.TRANSL: We would do better to build houses,” they said to one another.

S.FORM: qau seman tapaw a mapułat.
qao seman tapaw a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: So they all built houses.

S.FORM: sa azazua vatu ini anga ka garavagaw.
sa azazoa vato ini anga ka garavagaw.
S.TRANSL: And that dog didn’t move any more.

S.FORM: saka tsuay anga masan talau anga, aya a tjautsikel a masi
saka coay anga masan talao anga, aya a tjaocikel a masi
S.TRANSL: tsuay.
